name: Macro Oscillator 2
description: This algorithm is an implementation of the open source Plaits [88] module by Ã‰milie Gillet. This version should behave and sound identical to the original, based on v1.2 of the Plaits code. The disting NT firmware relies on 'input' settings (enabled/disabled) instead of jack detection to determine behavior, such as whether triggers are active or envelopes are used. It includes two outputs ('Main' and 'Aux'), which can be mixed if set to the same bus.
gui_description: The interface mimics the original Plaits module, featuring two output buses ('Main' and 'Aux'), extensive parameter controls for synthesis models, tuning, harmonics, timbre, morphing, FM depth, and envelope settings. Inputs can be routed via bus selection or MIDI/I2C modes.

input_ports.name: Trigger input (bus)
input_ports.description: Selectable bus for trigger signals. When set to 'None' (0), the algorithm generates constant sound.

input_ports.name: Level input (bus)
input_ports.description: Selectable bus for level modulation inputs.

input_ports.name: CV input (bus)
input_ports.description: Selectable bus for pitch CV inputs. MIDI/I2C in Pitch mode acts equivalently to a connected CV input.

input_ports.name: FM input (bus)
input_ports.description: Selectable bus for FM modulation inputs.

input_ports.name: Harmonics input (bus)
input_ports.description: Selectable bus for harmonics modulation inputs.

input_ports.name: Timbre input (bus)
input_ports.description: Selectable bus for timbre modulation inputs.

input_ports.name: Morph input (bus)
input_ports.description: Selectable bus for morph modulation inputs.

output_ports.name: Main output
output_ports.description: Primary audio output. Can be mixed with Aux if set to the same bus.

output_ports.name: Aux output
output_ports.description: Secondary audio output. Can be mixed with Main if set to the same bus.
